transcripts.text: This is the resiliency garden at the ICA, VCU.  Today, we're putting soil in the boxes, preparing for us to install plants.  Communities throughout the Richmond region experience a lack of healthy food access.  Really, this space is all about black space mattering, how it's important for African-American communities to have space that could be regenerative, that also addresses food access and climate resiliency at the same time.
